flows.title: Quick Decision Maker Signup
flows.description: User who already knows what they want signs up immediately with minimal exploration.
browser_actions: Navigate to https://www.atob.com and quickly scan the main hero section for the value proposition.
Locate and click the prominently displayed 'Get Started' or 'Apply Now' button on the homepage.
On the sign-up form (https://www.atob.com/get-started), efficiently fill in required fields such as company name, contact info, and fleet size.
Click the 'Submit Application' button to proceed to the next step or confirmation.

flows.title: Detailed Product Research
flows.description: User wants to understand all features and benefits in depth before considering application.
browser_actions: Navigate to https://www.atob.com and browse the top navigation or look for a 'Learn More' section about products.
Click on a link titled 'Fuel Cards' or 'Our Product' to access the dedicated product page (https://www.atob.com/product-fuel-cards).
Scroll thoroughly down the product page, reading detailed descriptions of features, benefits, use cases, and FAQs.
Investigate specific sections like 'How it Works', 'Key Benefits', and 'Eligibility Criteria' to gain a full understanding.

flows.title: Cost & Savings Comparison
flows.description: User is focused on understanding pricing, fees, and potential savings to compare with competitors.
user_goals: Find information about fees and costs
browser_actions: Navigate to https://www.atob.com, immediately looking for 'Pricing', 'Savings', or 'Cost' related links on the homepage.
If no direct pricing page link, click on 'Fuel Card Details' or 'Product' to reach https://www.atob.com/product-fuel-cards, anticipating cost and savings information there.
On the product page, actively scan for sections detailing fees, discounts, typical savings, or the presence of a savings calculator.
Note down key figures or take a screenshot to facilitate external comparison with competitor offerings.

flows.title: Returning Visitor Re-evaluation
flows.description: User has visited before, possibly to gather information, and is now returning to re-evaluate or take the next step.
browser_actions: Navigate directly to https://www.atob.com, potentially from a browser bookmark or direct URL entry.
Scroll briefly on the homepage to see if there are any new announcements or prominent calls to action since their last visit.
Click on 'Fuel Card Details' to revisit https://www.atob.com/product-fuel-cards and re-evaluate specific features or benefits that were previously unclear or of new interest.
After reviewing details on the product page, click on the 'Get Started' or 'Apply Now' call-to-action button, which leads to https://www.atob.com/get-started.
Begin filling out the signup form, potentially benefiting from browser autofill for previously entered details.

flows.title: Mobile On-the-Go Information Search
flows.description: User is on a mobile device, looking for quick, essential information about the fuel card.
user_goals: Find a clear call to action
browser_actions: Open a mobile browser and type in https://www.atob.com.
Quickly scroll down the mobile-optimized homepage, focusing on headlines, concise value propositions, and prominent call-to-action buttons.
Tap on the hamburger menu icon (if present) to reveal navigation options, then select 'Fuel Cards' or 'Product' to go to https://www.atob.com/product-fuel-cards.
On the product page, quickly scroll to find bulleted lists of key features and concise benefit summaries, avoiding detailed paragraphs.
Locate and tap a clear, thumb-friendly 'Apply Now' or 'Get Started' button to consider the next step (e.g., proceeding to a simplified signup form or lead capture).
